alfredsnippet.snippet:
The Nature of the Physical World, Sir A. Eddington (1928), p.279

"The physicist now regards his own external world in a way which I can only describe as mystical, though not less exact and practical, than that which prevailed some years ago, when it was taken for granted that nothing could be true unless an engineer could make a model of it."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Eddington's Mystical Universe
